alert.note: Alert for Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 18 at 1:46PM MST until January 20 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River Near Gila River at Calva affecting Graham County. For the Upper Gila...including Gila River at Calva...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Gila River Near Gila River at Calva. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Low-lying riparian areas flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM MST Wednesday the stage was 8.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.1 feet late tomorrow morning. - Action stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Gila River Gila River at Calv 20.0 8.3 Wed 1 pm MST 16.8 13.2 9.1 &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 500 AM MST.
